title: For Sale:  Torx Head Windage Screws for Redfield/Leupold/Burris/Millet Style Bases
postcontent:
For sale:  A pair of windage screws, for ALL Redfield style bases.  These screws are a major improvement, over the plain slotted head type.  Although, they still have the slotted head; that isn’t what you use to tighten/loosen them; except in an emergency.

Instead, they use a #15 Torx driver, to tighten them.  You can then locktite them, & torque them, to 45 inch pounds.  When it comes time to remove them, no problem.

Consequently, your windage screws aren’t marred up, from using a flat blade screw driver, or a coin.

Shipping, in the lower 48 states is a flat rate of $1.69. For a shipping Quote to Alaska, or Hawaii; please call us at REDACTED

We take all major credit cards, with a 3% credit card sur-charge. We will also take a check, but we will have to delay shipping for a couple days; on out-of-state checks.

When the situation demands fast shooting... And a big scope with a narrow field of view won't cut it, the StikeFire red dot riflescope lets you shoot with both eyes open! With unlimited field of view and eye relief nothing gets you on target faster than this tough, shockproof and waterproof compact little red dot scope. The rugged StrikeFire red dot is a perfect match with the popular flat-top AR-15 rifles and is also compatible with night vision optics. title: For Sale:  Torx Head Windage Screws for Redfield/Leupold/Burris/Millet Style Bases
postcontent:
For sale:  A pair of windage screws, for ALL Redfield style bases (Redfield, Leupold, Burris, Millet, to name a few).  These screws are a major improvement, over the plain slotted head type.  Although, they still have the slotted head; that isn’t what you use to tighten/loosen them; except in an emergency.

Instead, they use a #15 Torx driver, to tighten them.  You can then locktite them, & torque them, to 45 inch pounds.  When it comes time to remove them; no problem.

Consequently, your windage screws aren’t marred up, from using a flat blade screw driver, or a coin.

Shipping, in the lower 48 states is a flat rate of $1.69. For a shipping Quote to Alaska, or Hawaii; please call us at REDACTED

We take all major credit cards, with a 3% credit card sur-charge. We will also take a check, but we will have to delay shipping for a couple days; on out-of-state checks.

Thank you.

title: For Sale:  Beretta NANO 9mm Pistol
postcontent:
The Beretta Nano is the ultimate evolution of the micro compact carry pistol.
Utilizing a removable, serialized sub-chassis the Nano pistol can be easily modified with replaceable grip frames and is simple to disassemble and maintain.
Ease of use and concealment were key drivers in the development of the Nano.
The Nano’s extremely low profile, snag free design makes it easy to carry and draw from concealment. To accommodate right or left-handed use, the Nano’s magazine release button can be easily reversed. The light, durable, frame employs modern thermoplastic technology through the use of fiberglass reinforced technopolymer.
The Nano’s sights are user adjustable with a 1.3mm hexwrench and your fingers.
This allows anyone to adjust their sights without the assistance of a gunsmith.
Modular structure, ergonomics and ease of use make the Beretta Nano the ideal firearm for concealed carry.
Made in The U.S.A.

New KSG

This simple and reliable pump action feeds from either the left or right tube. The feed side is manually selected by a lever located behind the trigger guard.

The pump includes an under picatinny rail for the mounting of a forward grip, a light, or a laser. The included top picatinny sight rail will accept many types of optics or iron sights. Forward and rear sling loops are built in, and a basic sling is included. The soft rubber butt pad helps to tame recoil.

The KSG receiver is made from hardened steel and includes the magazine tubes which have been welded in place. The grip and stock assembly is made of glass reinforced nylon (Zytel) and is easily disassembled by pushing out 2 pins, which store in 2 holes in the grip when removed. The barrel and pump assembly is removed by loosening the 2 front magazine tube nuts with a coin and sliding the assembly forward.

location: Raleigh/Clayton NC Area, Raleigh / Durham / CH, North Carolina
postcontent:
This is a stock that will turn your Ruger 10/22 into an AR Training Rifle. There is no gunsmithing needed to install the Ruger 10/22 action and barrel. All you need is a Phillips and flat head screwdriver. That is it. In five minutes you are ready to shoot.

This is the LE Tactical Trainer Stock, not the standard Tapco version. It has the Tapco “SAW” style pistol grip, six position collapsible stock and FOUR Picitinny rails on the front to attach anything you (want which is the big difference between the standard and Tactical Trainer).

This is also not one of the stocks that only takes the standard tapered barrel or the .920 Bull Barrel. It is made to fit both. This version also came with all of the optional accessories that you don’t find in all of the sets. It came with the removable top rail for optics, rubber butt pad, extra angled buffer tube, sling attachment and bottom rail cover that that completely reshapes the bottom of the fore end. 

I also bought two grips for this stock. They are both Tapco Intrafuse grips to keep with the look of the stock and “SAW” style grip. One is a stubby grip that has inside storage for batteries with a removable rubber bottom. The other is the full size grip / bipod combo. It has the same storage and rubber bottom as the stubby but is longer and also has a polymer bipod that inserts in the bottom.

I have put a lot of money in the accessories to make it feel just like an AR15 to use for training. Listed below are all of the accessories that this comes with along with the prices I paid for them as well as the link to the Tapco site: 

- LE Tactical Trainer Stock ($105) http://www.tapco.com/products/ruger/index.php?_a=viewProd&productId=139 
- Optional Rubber Butt Pad (came with Tactical Trainer set)
- Optional Tapco bottom rail cover (came with Tactical Trainer set)
- Extra angled buffer tube (came with Tactical Trainer set)
- Sling Attachment (came with Tactical Trainer set)
- Removable Fore End Top Rail (came with Tactical Trainer set)
- Four ERGO Rail Covers ordered to cover these rails with a grip installed ($25)
- Tapco Intrafuse Stubby Vertical Fore End Grip with storage ($25)
- Tapco Intrafuse Vertical Fore End Grip Bipod Combo ($40)
*** TOTAL COST NEW: $195

I did pay retail for this as I ordered most of it off of Amazon. The only place I could put my hands on it was Bass Pro Shop and they wanted $150 for the stock alone. If you don’t believe the prices are the correct… just run them on Amazon. I put a lot of detail in this description so you know EXACTLY what you are getting and what shape it is in. I am selling this because I just got an insane deal on an M&P 1522 and no longer need it. It is used but if I put a new one beside it you could not tell the difference. It is perfect. I am willing to toss in a Ruger BX-25 magazine that is $29 new if you buy the entire kit. The BX-25 holds 25 rounds of 22lr to help with that “AR” transition. I am asking $170 for the entire kit, including the BX-25 magazine. I paid close to $225 for all of this new and it is in that condition so I believe $170 is a fair price. If you do not want the magazine I will deduct $20 from the price and sell it for $150. The price is fair so please don’t send a low ball offer. I am not pressed for money so before I give it away, I will just toss it back in the safe.

If you are interested I live in the Raleigh/Clayton area but I also travel for a living between Winston-Salem and Wilmington on a regular basis so pickup should be easy. If you are interested please let me know and thanks for looking.

title: For Sale:  Russian M91 Mosin Nagant w/ Hex Receiver
postcontent:
I have for sale a Russian M91 Mosin Nagant, manufactured by Izhevsk arsenal in 1923.  It comes with a sling, two stripper clips, and 573 rds of ammo.  The rifle does not have matching parts and the stock could use refinishing, but it shoots perfectly for me and the rifling is in great shape considering its age.  I've used it for a little fun on the range and for hunting, but I'm trying to free up a little room in my gun safe.  

It is an old rifle, and it will tire out your shoulder, but if you are looking for a cheap rifle that is well made and very inexpensive to shoot, then give this rifle a good home!  I'm asking $260 for the entire set, which is a pretty good deal considering no shipping, tax, or FFL costs.  $20 discount for active duty military/law enforcement/firefighters, women, and NRA members.  I will not break up what I am selling or ship.  Cash only.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Archangel precision Mosin
postcontent:
I have a fully customized Archangel Mosin Nagant, the only thing stock/original is the receiver which is in excellent condition and the action is very smooth. 

A gunsmith performed all the work on it, including barrel install, bolt turn-down, scope mount tapping and installation and final fit to the precision stock.

Below is what went into it, all at excellent prices and do not account for any type of shipping, taxes, etc.
Mosin ($100)
New barrel to replace the surplus stock barrel ($125)
Archangel stock (fully adjustable length of pull and cheek weld. Magazine fed)
Turned down bolt
Rock Solid Ltd Scope mount ($75) 
Also have 40 rds of factory Winchester soft points (deer/bore rounds) ($45) and some surplus stuff somewhere as well (Negligible value).

That does not include any gunsmith work, which cost over $200.

If you are not familiar with the 7.62x54r round, its bigger than a 308 and more devastating, and you can get surplus rounds for 22 cents a round (so 5 rounds for every one round of average/cheap 308).

If you put this whole thing together using the best prices you can possibly find on-line, you would spend around $700. I would like $550 cash or I LOVE trades.

This automatic clay trap is equipped with a sprocket mechanism that enables it to throw 70 yards, making it an optimal choice for the casual shooter. When compared to a full-sized cock trap, the Do All Outdoors Backyard 3/4" Single Cock Trap offers a quieter and more stable choice that is also easier to use. When you spend the entire day shooting outdoors, you can rely on the automatic clay trap for superior performance. This clay target thrower is equipped with a three-pivot mount that gives the shooter the necessary flexibility to throw any target at a variety of angles and speeds.
When you need to change positions for the next round, this clay target thrower is equipped with three bolts that can be easily adjusted to throw a target from a variety of positions. Whether you are aiming for a springing teal, a ground-bouncing rabbit, a flushing pair of standards, or curling incomers, this automatic clay trap has the necessary components and features you need.

title: For Sale:  (SOLD) Glock 17L 9mm Pistol (+8 17rd & +3 33rd Mags)
postcontent:
Pre-owned in excellent condition. Modified trigger.

This pistol includes everything as pictured. Gen 3. Adjustable sights. It also includes 8 additional 17-round magazines and three 33-round magazines. All the magazines are Glock Factory Original. This will give you a total of 13 original magazines. The firearm itself is in very good to like-new condition. Used at the range only. No carry or competition use.

The firearm has a modified trigger from Glockworx. It is a drop-in replacement, so there are no permanent modifications to the firearm. It makes squeezing the trigger smooth as silk at about a 2.2lbs trigger pull. It also includes a smoother drop safety and skeleton striker. Housing has an adjustment for overtravel. Again, this is just a drop-in part. You can replace it with a factory stock trigger (not included) and housing and the firearm will return to a factory stock Glock.

Let's do the math. On the auction site, a 17L will sell for about $800. Magazines are about $25. The 33rd magazines run $35. The trigger from Glockworx is about $200. So, that's $1305 in materials, selling locally here for $875.

This is a private sale. All sales must be completed locally. You will be required to present your permit to purchase or carry permit and sign a bill of sale. Cash only. Item is located near Anoka, MN.

Please send a message through the 'Contact Seller' button if you're interested. Thank you!

Also, check out my other listings. I'm selling the bulk of my firearm collection. This is a one-time event to score big, so check it out!
